name: Radiator 2: Anniversary Edition
description: A free collection of three short experimental games (Hurt Me Plenty, Succulent, and Stick Shift) about male sexuality, punishing, eating, and driving.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 or later Processor: Intel Core i3 2.0 GHz or AMD equivalent Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: Video card with 512 MB of VRAM (DX9 / SM3.0 compatible) DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 500 MB available space Additional Notes: (basically something manufactured within the last 2-3 years)

reviews.review_text: >> sets steam to Offline Mode >> Plays for hours

A game to play 'because it's funny', when it's 2 am and you have nothing else to do.  You might play it at other times, but then it's harder to justify.   Seriously though, it will give you some good laughs, and you don't need to be gay to enjoy it.
as a woman, I like this theme especially spanking... as a player I like it for achievements
As a gay person, I just love the proposal of the game. But I think the game is kinda creepy, I don't know. There's something disturbing on it.  Worth the try.

A childhood classic!
One of the weirdest games I've ever played. It's free, try it though.

A small collection of short, fun, free, homoerotic games. What's not to love? Well, Stick Shift. That game is really frustrating. And the lack of Rinse and Repeat. Otherwise highly recommended for people with a sense of humor.

This game made me feel fabulous, the story is absolutely breathtaking and I love it. The hidden level kept me on the edge of my seat with the homosexual banter and condom shooting. All of the minigames are great. This game is worth every penny I spent on it.  10/10 I think I'm gay.
